name: NIST Emerging & Mobile Network Technologies projects
body: #What is this page about? This page presents some research artifacts that were spawn from the Secure Smargrid project with the Emering & Mobile Network Techonologies group (EMNTG) at NIST. We believe that sharing our code on GitHub we will make it more accessible and foster more contribution. Because the code derives from our research, it should be considered as experimental and sometimes incomplete. Also, some contribution are meant to be used together. Please note that this page is not the official page of the Emerging & Mobile Network Technologies group at NIST. It only presents a small subset of our group's contributions. People interested to find more about our group can go on [our official website](http://www.nist.gov/itl/antd/emntg/index.cfm). #Projects ## IEEE 802.15.4 networks emulation ### [wiredto154](https://github.com/nist-emntg/wiredto154) *A IEEE 802.15.4 PHY layer emulator over Ethernet links* TBA ### [wiredto154-logger](https://github.com/nist-emntg/wiredto154-logger) *Logging tool for wiredto154 simulations* ## Works related to the RedBee Econotag For our testbed, we use the RedBee Econotag. We wrote some code in order to better manage the device. ### [serialreadts](https://github.com/nist-emntg/serialreadts) *Serial port reading with timestamp information (serialreadts)* ## Implementation of the RPL routing protocol (RFC 6550) ### [simpleRPL](https://github.com/nist-emntg/simpleRPL) *A linux-based implementation of the Routing Protocol for Low-Power and Lossy Networks (RPL)* TBA ### [Routing](https://github.com/nist-emntg/Routing) *a libnl-route binding for python* TBA ### [RplIcmp](https://github.com/nist-emntg/RplIcmp) *A python module for handling ICMP messaging for the RPL protocol* ### [virtual-ieee802154-serial](https://github.com/nist-emntg/virtual-ieee802154-serial) *Virtual tunnel interface for the IEEE 802.15.4 serial protocol* ### [linux802154-serialdev](https://github.com/nist-emntg/linux802154-serialdev) *Friendly fork of Mariano Alvira's linux serial driver firmware for the Redbee Econotag* TBA ### [linux802154-regression-tests](https://github.com/nist-emntg/linux802154-regression-tests) *Regression tests for the Linux IEEE 802.15.4 and 6LoWPAN stack* TBA ## Contiki related code ## [ecc-light-certificate](https://github.com/nist-emntg/ecc-light-certificate) *A simple ECC certificate library* TBA #License Unless explicitly stated, all the software referenced on this page follow the license below: Conditions Of Use This software was developed by employees of the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), and others. This software has been contributed to the public domain. Pursuant to title 15 United States Code Section 105, works of NIST employees are not subject to copyright protection in the United States and are considered to be in the public domain. As a result, a formal license is not needed to use this software. This software is provided "AS IS." NIST MAKES NO WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT AND DATA ACCURACY. NIST does not warrant or make any representations regarding the use of the software or the results thereof, including but not limited to the correctness, accuracy, reliability or usefulness of this software.
